info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 4:50AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...AN INTENSE LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND AFFECTING THE SYRACUSE METRO AREA AND MADISON COUNTY... A narrow but intense band of lake effect snow is affecting the Syracuse metro area early this morning, and stretches from near Cato, through the north and east sides of Syracuse, to Manlius and just near Hamilton. The band will slowly drop to the south over the next hour, and may affect downtown and south side of Syracuse shortly. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible within this band, and visibility will drop below one quarter mile at times, as northwest winds gusting to 25 mph cause considerable blowing snow. Lake effect snow is expected to re-focus south of Syracuse later this morning. Additional scattered snow showers are expected to redevelop this afternoon and evening. Early morning commuters should allow extra time to reach their destinations. &&
